Privacy Policy

Last updated: January 01, 2024

Information We Collect

When you use our Pet Tracker application, we collect several types of information to provide and improve our service:

Pet Information

  • Pet name, breed, age, and physical characteristics
  • Medical information including allergies, medications, and veterinary contacts
  • Contact information for pet owners and emergency contacts
  • NFC tag identification numbers

Location Data

  • GPS coordinates when location services are enabled
  • Location history for tracking purposes
  • Geofence configurations and alerts

Technical Information

  • Device information and browser type
  • Usage patterns and app interactions
  • Error logs and performance data

Authentication Data

  • Patreon account information (when using Patreon OAuth)
  • Authentication tokens and session data

How We Use Your Information

We use the collected information for the following purposes:

Primary Services

  • Provide pet tracking and location services
  • Store and manage pet medical records
  • Enable emergency contact and alert systems
  • Manage NFC tag registrations and associations

Service Improvement

  • Analyze usage patterns to improve app functionality
  • Troubleshoot technical issues and bugs
  • Develop new features based on user needs

Communication

  • Send important service notifications
  • Provide customer support
  • Share updates about new features

Data Storage and Security

We take data security seriously and implement multiple layers of protection:

GitHub Integration

  • Data is stored using GitHub's secure infrastructure
  • All communications use HTTPS encryption
  • Access is controlled through GitHub's authentication system

Local Storage

  • Some data is cached locally on your device for offline access
  • Local data is encrypted where possible
  • You can clear local data at any time through your browser

Third-Party Services

  • MongoDB for scalable data storage with encryption at rest
  • Patreon for optional user authentication
  • Location services through browser APIs

Data Retention

  • Pet information is retained as long as your account is active
  • Location history may be automatically purged after 12 months
  • You can request data deletion at any time

Data Sharing and Disclosure

We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information. We may share information only in these limited circumstances:

Emergency Situations

  • When you explicitly trigger an emergency alert
  • To assist in locating lost pets
  • To provide medical information to veterinarians or emergency responders

Service Providers

  • Third-party services that help us operate the application
  • All service providers are bound by strict confidentiality agreements
  • Data sharing is limited to what's necessary for service provision

Legal Requirements

  • When required by law or legal process
  • To protect our rights, property, or safety
  • To protect the rights, property, or safety of our users or the public

Your Rights and Choices

You have several rights regarding your personal information:

Access and Control

  • View and update your pet information at any time
  • Export your data in a portable format
  • Delete specific information or your entire account

Location Services

  • Choose whether to enable location tracking
  • Set up geofences and location alerts
  • View and delete location history

Communications

  • Opt out of non-essential communications
  • Choose your preferred contact methods
  • Control emergency alert settings

Data Portability

  • Download your pet information and medical records
  • Export location data and tracking history
  • Transfer data to other services (where technically feasible)

Children's Privacy

Our service is not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If we become aware that a child under 13 has provided us with personal information, we will take steps to remove such information and terminate the child's access to our service.

If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us immediately so we can take appropriate action.

International Data Transfers

Our service is hosted primarily in the United States through GitHub Pages and other US-based services. By using our application, you consent to the transfer of your information to the United States and other countries where our service providers operate.

We ensure that any international transfers comply with applicable data protection laws and that appropriate safeguards are in place to protect your personal information.

Changes to This Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons. When we make changes, we will:

  • Update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this policy
  • Notify users of significant changes through the application
  • Obtain consent for material changes that affect how we use your information

We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically to stay informed about how we protect your information.

Contact Information

If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us through:

  • GitHub Issues: Create an issue in our repository for privacy-related questions
  • In-App Contact: Use the contact form within the Pet Tracker application
  • Emergency Contact: For urgent privacy concerns, use the emergency contact feature

We will respond to privacy inquiries within 30 days of receipt. For urgent matters, we strive to respond within 48 hours.

Specific Provisions by Region

European Union (GDPR)

If you are located in the European Union, you have additional rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR):

  • Right to rectification of inaccurate personal data
  • Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten")
  • Right to restrict processing in certain circumstances
  • Right to data portability
  • Right to object to processing based on legitimate interests
  • Right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority

California (CCPA)

If you are a California resident, you have additional rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA):

  • Right to know what personal information we collect, use, disclose, and sell
  • Right to delete personal information we have collected
  • Right to opt-out of the sale of personal information (we do not sell personal information)
  • Right to non-discrimination for exercising your privacy rights
